description: This is a practical module that will provide students with the methodological tools necessary to analyse and reflect critically upon contemporary issues in bioethics, medicine and the biosciences. Students will be taught about various empirical methods that are commonly applied to the analysis of bioethical issues and learn how to apply them to theoretical frameworks. The module aims to develop student’s analytical and empirical research skills and apply them practically to research projects in bioethics. Key components of this module will relate to: • Introduction to ethical reasoning; • Epistemology and methodology; • Normative and conceptual analysis; and • Qualitative and quantitative research methods • Empirical bioethics
title: Topics in Bioethics Research Methods
